metadata.title: CVE-2022-38177 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
By spoofing the target resolver with responses that have a malformed ECDSA signature, an attacker can trigger a small memory leak. It is possible to gradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lack of resources.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.18.4-2ubuntu1
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.18.4-2ubuntu1
bind9-host - 1:9.18.4-2ubuntu1
bind9-libs - 1:9.18.4-2ubuntu1
bind9-utils - 1:9.18.4-2ubuntu1
bind9utils - 1:9.18.4-2ubuntu1
dnsutils - 1:9.18.4-2ubuntu1
No subscription required
